subject: Fashion
title: Beau Brummell's Dandy Revolution
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Beau Brummell's Dandy Revolution.

hook.text: Beau Brummell spent five hours getting dressed every morning. He ironed his cravat with champagne.

buildup.text: In Regency England, he rejected aristocratic excess and championed clean lines and perfect tailoring.

discovery.text: His radical idea: clothes should fit the body, not drown it in decoration. Simplicity was the new power.

twist.text: Brummell wasn't rich or titled. He became the most influential man in England through style alone.

climax.text: He invented modern menswear: the clean suit, daily bathing, and the idea that elegance means restraint.

punchline.text: One man's obsession became every man's uniform.

quiz.question: What was Beau Brummell's radical contribution to men's fashion?
options: He introduced bright colors and elaborate embroidery to suits
He championed perfect fit, clean lines, and simplicity over decoration
He created the first casual menswear line for working-class men
